title-group.article-title: Entropy Generation in Flow Restrictions: Modeling and Identification for Engine Control

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2001 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: An alternative method to modeling ans identification of flow restrictions builts-in the IC engine air-flow system has been pro-posed. It is based on modeling of flow losses, i.e the entropy change avoiding detailed geomentry modeling. It allows to generate the integrated model of flow restriction covering all operating modes in one equation and, to some extent, to predict the temperature ratio over the flow restriction. A modified version of the model has been elaborated to achieve the computational stability. The model has been verified using the experimental data from SAAB' 95 production engine throttle plate.

ref.mixed-citation: Michael Jensen E. Hendriks, Alain Chevalier, Spencer Sorenson, D. Trumpy, and Joe Asik. Modeling of the intake manifold filling dynamics. SAE Technical paper 960037, 1996.
A. A. Sokolov and S.T. Glad. Identifiability of turbocharged IC engine models. SAE Technical paper, March N 1999-010206.
Sokolov A.A. On quazi-one-dimensional modeling of fluid flow in tubes. Technical Report 2111,Linköping University, 1999.
Sokolov A.A. Generalized model of flow restrictions for engine control applications. Technical Report 2120, Linköping University, 1999.
John B. Heywood. Internal Combustion Engine Fundamentals. McGraw-Hill, 1988.
Miloslav Feistauer. Mathematical Methods in fluid dynamics. John Wiley and Sons, 1993.
